fields.description:
DoD:

Cloud admin can customize the logos, icons and text in the UI.

Cases:

1. Logo is customizable.
2. Icons are customizable.
3. Texts are customizable.
4. Contact information is customizable.


TO DO: BE MORE SPECIFIC

comments.body: if this helps, icons are used on instance landing page, launch instance wizard, image landing page...
As of now (8/20) all cases should be working.
Need help from developers on how to test this feature. How does a user customize the items list in the test cases?

== QA REVIEW ==
CODE: latest source(09/12/12) on Ubuntu Precise

NOTE: Yet unclear on how to test this feature.

== QA REVIEW ==
CODE: latest source(10/03/12) on Centos 6.3

NOTE: Unclear on how to test this feature.

If you'd like to customize UI you can update images and/or translate it.
If you'd like to change images you need to update images stored in the static/images/ folder or rewrite eucalyptus.css file to pull your custom images.
If you'd like to translate UI you need to provide translation file and update language property in console.ini file.
Pushed to Sprint 7.
Additionally request that falls under this story - ability to change GUI to use [Twitter Bootstrap|http://twitter.github.io/bootstrap/].  Maybe we just need more documentation on how to achieve this?
Isn't that a different framework?   I don't know that its a customization.   [~jloza] ?
[~shashi], is this story still on the list for 3.4?
[~hspencer], could you elaborate on Twitter Bootstrap idea? Is there are any reason we need to use this framework?

I'm out of town and not logged in to jira but yes it's a different framework that controls CSS. It is awesome but not what we are using. CSS is customizable.

Sent from my iPad

ok, so [~hspencer], I believe we'd have to rewrite the console to use this framework, its not a "customization".  We currently are using (and completing the move to) backbone.js (based on JQuery libraries using javascript).  We chose backbone.js due to its scaling properties and ability to create a MVC style architecture allowing parallel development.   Its also a proven technology, utilized by many different highly scaling sites, you can see here, including Groupon, WalMart mobile, Pandora, USA Today, and many others:  http://backbonejs.org/#examples

Hey [~vasya],

The request was just a reference request (i.e. we would like to customize the GUI; for example, incorporate Twitter Bootstrap with the UI).  Sorry about the confusion here.  I should worded the request to better cover the question.  The main thing here is the documentation on how to customize it.

[~tjcramer], knowing that we use the backbone.js framework is great information.  Looking at this request, it looks like my initial request should have been a documentation request around how to customize the User Console UI using backbone.js?  Thoughts?

[~hspencer], it depends on what you want to do.   This is really about forking the Console and re-writing/implementing new functionality.  backbone.js will add/change functionality.  changing the CSS is the "look and feel".   How to do this would be the architecture doc/design doc for the Console.

[~tjcramer], having documentation on how to change the look and feel (with CSS) would satisfy the main request.  Bonus points for documenting how to change/add functionality (with backbone.js) would be great.  Agreed regarding the arch doc/design doc for the User Console.  Do we already have requests in for those docs? I checked on github and saw the following:

* https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/wiki/Designdocs-ui
* https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/wiki/Ui-Guide

Should we create a separate DOC ticket to track this?

Yes, we shoudl have a separate doc ticket for a guide to the new arch/design. The architecture has changed substantially between 3.2 (when those docs were written) and 3.3.0. [~scottb] has been talking about doing a new arch doc. 

OTOH, creating a guide to the CSS would be EXTREMELY time consuming and probably not necessary. A good CSS person should be able to simply look at the classes and be able to adjust things as needed. Anyone attempting to change the look and feel should have a good handle on CSS in general and with that can figure out what to do, and if they don't, trying to change CSS will be an exercise in frustration (this is true for any app, not particular to Eucalyptus).

[~tjcramer], Does this need to be on the list for 3.4? Recent conversation with [~jloza] on a separate thread confirmed that the GUI is fully customizable (as expected), and that there is nothing from an implementation perspective that needs to be done. Do you think we should put this back on the radar for 3.4? 

[~jloza], However, I feel we should be in a position to provide basic guidelines on customization. For example, we could pick the logo, login title, contact info, or such fields in the GUI and provide guidelines on how to accomplish customizations. As you rightly point out, we should NOT attempt to build extensive documentation on this. Just samples for customizing one or two assets (logos, name of the company, etc.) would be very helpful. Let me know what you think.
[~shashi], if the definition of this request is to provide a couple of examples, then I think that's very doable.  If its programmatic, then I don't think so (for 3.4).
Yup, just a handful of examples for the logo, login page, a field name, company name, etc. would be helpful. We can add more examples later, if needed.
